verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
ity udīritam ākarṇya
devaṛṣer uddhavo 'bravīt
sabhyānāṁ matam ājñāya
kṛṣṇasya ca mahā-matiḥ

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; iti—thus; udīritam—that which was stated; ākarṇya—hearing; deva-ṛṣeḥ—by Nārada, the sage of the demigods; uddhavaḥ—Uddhava; abravīt—spoke; sabhyānām—of the members of the royal assembly; matam—the opinion; ājñāya—understanding; kṛṣṇasya—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; ca—and; mahā-matiḥ—great-minded.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: Having thus heard the statements of Devarṣi Nārada, and understanding the opinions of both the assembly and Lord Kṛṣṇa, the great-minded Uddhava began to speak.
